results.title: A Shame Like Alice. Part 2 (A)
results.creator_credit: Leonard Lee, SBS-TV and Lee Gordon Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Focus”.
Presents the view of the white population of Alice Springs concerning its Aborigines, including those of the mayor and a councillor concerning “assimilation” problems. Shows, in contrast, Aboriginal self-help ventures in education and health. Aborigines relate their feelings about the intrusion of the media and tourism into their lives. Includes interviews with the then Senator Neville Bonner and former Commissioner for Community Affairs, Al Grassby.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leonard Lee, SBS-TV and Lee Gordon Productions

results.title: A Shame like Alice. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Leonard Lee, SBS-TV and Lee Gordon Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Focus”.
A look at the plight of the Aboriginal people in and around Alice Springs, presenting the black viewpoint. Discusses racism in the town, the type of housing and services available to the Aboriginal people and other issues. Includes interviews with the then Senator Neville Bonner and former Commissioner for Community Relations, Al Grassby.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leonard Lee, SBS-TV and Lee Gordon Productions

results.title: Outsiders within
results.creator_credit: Gordon Brick and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.
Examines the plight of illegal immigrants awaiting deportation at Villawood Detention Centre, New South Wales. Outlines the allegations of denial of basic human rights presented at a Human Rights Commission inquire into the Centre’s operations. Presents the views of Stuard West, the Minister for Immigration and Ethnic Affairs, and Peter Bailey, the Human Rights Commissioner, concerning the treatment of illegal immigrants. Al Grassby, former Commissioner for Community Relations, also speaks out on human rights.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gordon Brick and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service

results.title: The Cost (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.
FOCUS looks at the plight of some unemployed Australians and the cost in human terms of Australia’s and the world’s - most pressing problem.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.
The plight of Australia’s Aborigines around Alice Springs. Are Aborigines being treated in accordance with the United Nations Charter which states all human beings should be free and equal? Includes interviews with Neville Bonner and Al Grassby

results.title: Love by arrangement (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Gordon Bick and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.
Looks at traditional arranged marriages carried out in Australia by various migrant groups. Presents interviews with members of the Muslim and English communities, discussing their views on arranged marriage and the selection of prospective partners.

results.title: A Matter of communication (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Leonard Lee and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.
FOCUS looks at the difficulties experienced by many migrants in understanding the Anglo-Saxon legal system and investigates the way people are treated at the hands of the law. A Vietnamese man in condemned for killing a dog for consumption and a Lebanese man allegedly is bashed by police.

results.title: Two Different Worlds (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.
A story of children challenging the attitudes of their migrant parents and growing apart from their discipline and culture. The repercussions of holding two standards - that of their parents and that of the new Australian society. How do they cope with two values.
